comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: These look more Cambodian than East Indian - religious styled temple relief statues - Could be Siamese (our Thailand) - Lion or lion dog guardian statue in front of facial figures - lotus pose seated yogi (yoga)  figure above left head sculpture - Could be part of the Indo Chinese exhibit

comment.author: 35305135@N08
comment._content:
To me these are figures from the Khmer civilization. The faces of the two statues there are unmistakably Khmer as well as the guardian lion.

The faces resemble the faces from the Bayon temple in Angkor from the reign of King Jayavarman VII.

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: Great observations.  Thanks for the info.

comment.author: 14350553@N04
comment._content: Hi - we're the San Antonio Public Library and we have used your image on our Library Art Guide. It will be up during 07.09. Thank you for sharing it with us and our patrons. guides.mysapl.org/art

comment.author: 59774957@N02
comment._content: In my opinion, the sculpture is not related to the Bayon Style, which is always demonstrate eyes semi-close, semi-open. with little smile similar to the famous Monalisa of Da Vinci.
